document.title: Faith Formation (Religion) Curriculum Framework Standards and Benchmarks: Grade 4

DC049FB6AA914628AD55E35A91798FC3.description: Students will know that we are called to be stewards of our possessions.

ABD6A6CC3379484EB0AA75A3BB40FD1B.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the importance of care for God’s creation.

B405CF2979E74EB9B0F439ED19D8EAFB.description: Students will know that we try to live justly for the good of all people.

881DA0743BEE48CE946F52E729C85352.description: Students will know the meaning of social sin.

04BCBE7D87764C439B2B6BB15692B1F5.description: Students will grow in their understanding of solidarity.

06BFEBC600944BC08E2940269EF05A0A.description: Students will know that we are called to work for the good of all people.

87EF011DA44C4BDAA57ACE00BAB72DAB.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the dignity of the work and the rights of others.

E9B7C7ED5D6F4C03A7CBEF405FBB3AC4.description: Students will know the cardinal virtues of prudence, justice, fortitude and temperance.

2215FE536CBA46B1845DFCD4430270E1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the preferential option for the poor and vulnerable.

AB5B8E5267844673AB09D63242DB3D52.description: Students will know that they are responsible for their families and the larger community.

234CE9F95C6A45179C5269775628759F.description: Students will know that they are responsible for one another.

F6C90C54BA684DDEA33838D586667F36.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the rights of all people and their responsibilities towards others.

9E64491FD3E441F8948410D007B957B0.description: Students will know how to name at least one example of how they participate in family, community and society.

BD4C5925A63A4C0CB92CE1FD3F5AAC0A.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the call to family, community and participation in society.

E083CDF473E245DB913F852A6FAB5F8D.description: Students will know that social justice is based on the dignity of the human person.

60BE740BC06645E792FA1B77E55B03E1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the life and dignity of the human person.

ACB904F78CFC471CB48C71E2E9D1E73D.description: Students will know how to relate justice and service to practical examples in their lives.

4B769D190340498C9DC4BF48366B2ED3.description: Students will know some basic principles of Catholic social teaching.

88E623C19DFD4A2F8D45D32D20C49990.description: Students will grow in their understanding of justice and service.

F200160A948241CC8CB89D0826DFB66A.description: Students will know stories of how people put faith into action.

6028EEF5D1DA4371B98F3AE389ABCF17.description: Students will know the works of mercy.

7EF6887A46494F678D935257C20FC27A.description: Students will know that all life is sacred.

A32C47FC94DB40DCB329FDAE771EC0F0.description: Students will know to respect all forms of life.

44324A0981DF4D7BB8EB3B826335A33B.description: Students will grow in their knowledge of Catholic social teaching.

C34E930E314048B99AEE820D76749714.description: Students will know the liturgical role of altar server and reader.

953045B7BBEF466CA839113CBC871E36.description: Students will know the various liturgical ministries and how they lead us to a way of Christian living.

5679F93DE3474C0F9DFA12B2C9AB21E3.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the ministry of the Church.

93431237010645D3894CB151419B14FF.description: Students will know that deacons are member of the clergy and serve a catechetical, apostolic and liturgical role in the Church.

2F4143E53B714E68B5357781A12182DD.description: Students will know that the Pope is the pastor of the entire Church.

18A77D5EC7964A84B63965BDD28D3DCF.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Church life at parish, diocesan and universal levels.

00563DB1050F4FED938B255C22C8DBB7.description: Students will know that Jesus wants them to always grow in their faith.

C5122C54FD824D7C9991E8BF3264F954.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in life-long faith formation.

41BC2388758A4B1196AEFC55700C56CE.description: Students will know the importance of being members of the liturgical assembly.

18EAF2E146D34B98A8B7D3C67930C884.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the liturgical life of the Church.

CACB7C75E00B483AA360ED3CB27BCDB6.description: Students will know that all Christians are called to obey legitimate authority.

68AF02D936B44299BED56F7DDA05424A.description: Students will know the significance of the law [precepts] of the Church as rules for living the Christian life.

838118A43C194BD1B61C55EF4A75CF02.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church Law.

58DD587D9C2043589E50A70339ECA60A.description: Students will know that sin is a deliberate choice against God’s law.

13654FCCA7AC46638C548717D1594960.description: Students will know that the capital sins are pride, greed, envy, anger, lust, gluttony and laziness.

D074DFEA2757420C9EC2DC153E5911A1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Sin and Forgiveness.

BD13119DF98E4E3BA8E80CDEEAD258F2.description: Students will know that through our conscience God is calling us to continuing conversion.

232396D11A114624B6B0DCEEC0A367C8.description: Students will know that conscience is our secret core where God speaks to us.

408A5ABE17104F169EFE0E89D869B16D.description: Students will know that our feelings and emotions are gifts of God, but they are not always indicators of right and wrong.

196CB019A13B4B4586B93AA32D7AE422.description: Students will know how to do an examination of conscience in light of the beatitudes and ten commandments.

B3F1DBF887C54626BE0EAE703DDE2241.description: Students will know that we do good and avoid evil by following our conscience.

E217D5CC5E5547409FD9299676FD0028.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Conscience.

0BBCCF4984FC42CFAFFAB513C79AB149.description: Students will know that the tenth commandment is opposed to greed and covetousness.

5DD80ED2C8844E149FD4C40034D16298.description: Students will know that false witness and perjury are grave offenses against the truth.

048757CBDB3E4C67817B3176D0A7160C.description: Students will know the corporal works of mercy.

57412408BF7B422881DF90B302A314CA.description: Students will know that adultery is wrong and is the breaking of a promise.

859A91639788447F91762D3E6CF2E248.description: Students will know that men and women are equal in dignity yet have complimentary differences.

6AFEC046187244A8B29C05FF1D6CF39E.description: Students will know that deliberate hatred is contrary to charity.

675350C09646438C89CCEB14D29E166B.description: Students will know that the fifth commandment opposes murder and that all human life is sacred.

5B195DBE42494E938ECF7060C54A4E48.description: Students will know that the family is the image of the Trinity.

04F1E743DCF6464A9CE5A8DAF03ECBD0.description: Students will know that we must participate at Mass on Sundays and Holy Days of obligation.

240AD6232E9D492D920F521378D1FC61.description: Students will know that blasphemy is the use of the name of God, of Jesus Christ, of Mary and the saints in an offensive way.

2B7F9B55A0C64DB991AD71F4E7BEB7E5.description: Students will know that we look upon sacred images with reverence because of what they represent. We do no worship them.

3D2E2D919C0245C18403770EAE544F08.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Commandments.

B169379B0EAD466AAF7523B3706AE302.description: Students will know that the Beatitudes show us the path to the happiness to heaven.

555E9B789F5543ABBF5842925C98A5D1.description: Students will know the beatitudes and how they are a model for how we live.

52E5B4A492E04D11A9D6598BBAECF203.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Beatitudes.

575125EC5FA64A98A2FC66D33C802F8F.description: Students will know that God calls each of us to eternal happiness with himself.

7C20B3B025DB45B1A7C860796AB64D5D.description: Students will know that we are called to live out the Paschal Mystery in our own lives.

932D41EC75884F419249996940945316.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Life in Christ.

74A629399AD64967A6D489251E6EB14A.description: Students will know the Nicene Creed.

FD6EB17B312D44D4A8AFC7A05CC93387.description: Students will know that our prayer arises out of the liturgy.

992E6437D08445E8A17C18AD4E02DA07.description: Students will know that our prayer arises out of the liturgy.

B8BEB9786CFC434CAA844D703F1627C0.description: Students will know that Jesus teaches us how to pray in a way that is faith-filled.

A68DED8484EE45F4ADD5BD45D718F486.description: Students will grow in their understanding of prayer.

3B6032D540E34EF9973978C8782977E1.description: Students will participate in non-sacramental penitential services in order to lead them to regularly celebrate the Rite of Reconciliation.

BC9C3CF0E4B5433B958E7E339E4CB8D1.description: Students will know more of the many blessings of the Church.

81E5F3207E3E406A875C8B6AA961970C.description: Students will know how to pray a Celebration of the Word.

B3304C2CDE5448DEBD73F78FC06A09EE.description: Students will know how to pray morning and evening prayer.

39C6ED56AEDA4CB180C2F378468F9C80.description: Students will grow in their understanding of other Liturgical celebrations.

2FC815AEDF46458588D943C30F027B15.description: Students will know the different traditional symbols of each season.

E634E9026C894AAA8142D993D34CA7B4.description: Students will know the meaning of the Ascension and Pentecost.

E221F68E215E44EEB095FC283141F9D4.description: Students will know that on Sunday we celebrate the Resurrection in the liturgical assembly.

3DC050BA289B4FDBA8D4E053E3DDD5CB.description: Students will know that each season celebrates various aspects of the Paschal Mystery.

B58F006BC56349749DEA68CDD1BC0650.description: Students will know that the liturgical year has many different seasons.

5C9993EB584E441E8CEEFF3252D2E674.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Liturgical Year.

3002410ED17E4B19BE7F7BA0DF1812C6.description: Students will know that the family is the ‘domestic’ church.

A1437F927EE74A95B0D065F0877BFC82.description: Students will know that priests preach the Gospel, celebrate the Eucharist, and serve their parishes.

4684E8B8F80F44DAA6EEC31541DF6B9A.description: Students will know that Christ touched and healed people during his life on earth and continues to do so in the sacrament of the Anointing of the Sick.

A281B178878942C4B7FE64596595D14F.description: Students will know that the Church has the power to forgive sins through the sacrament of reconciliation.

3DFA6007BB4340298B2183947AAA4B88.description: Students will that that reconciliation with God is inseparable from reconciliation with the Church.

BB3AE336CCC34D8FB089695A6944D891.description: Students will know that in the sacrament of reconciliation we confess both personal and social sin.

2D947774A8B44CE5B4E53D58C9179F12.description: Students will know that in Confirmation we receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

B90CF8295B264732B4E7D2CBB3C725D0.description: Students will know that Confirmation is a sacrament of initiation.

472B27AE6E2E4697BD1D61B54C3323D4.description: Students will know the three sacraments of initiation: Baptism, which is the beginning of new life; Confirmation, which strengthens that life; and Eucharist which completes initiation and nourishes us with Christ’s Body and Blood.

39A9FB283804451CAE66960C67C8067F.description: Students will know there are seven sacraments.

F9BE71CC732542D0B0B53EAA953C1493.description: Students will know that the Church teaches that sacraments are necessary for salvation.

CBF92E828D744D528CEFAD92EBDFB82D.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Sacraments.

BA12EF2E29F146948EE8B93049AC590B.description: Students will know that the Eucharist is thanksgiving and praise to the Father.

ED2EDBB3853040D2A804CA5703BA2BC0.description: Students will know that the Eucharist feeds and forms us with Christ’s Body and Blood.

57A2AB124561418EADD7E56699466472.description: Students will know that they must continue to worship God every Sunday.

20DD419342D24488A7ACE49DA11A10CC.description: Students will know that the liturgy is the work of the Trinity.

7C3F1AB1D397448994E25FE0ACBABBFB.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Worship and prayer.

99CD1BA45D6F41D892FBB9A2BD5870FF.description: Students will know some of the great saints in the Church.

1DAC87687A9A481E85FA287643322317.description: Students will know that Mary is in heaven and continues to pray for us.

BCC9A433104B41CF8071C4A6BCB9CD27.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Saints.

4D6A1FF223104A9D8CED99CB96E78222.description: Students will know that at the beginning of history, Adam and Eve were tempted by Satan and disobeyed God.

F0B9707B299D419C8BE1F06156C9F3A7.description: Students will know that God is the author of scripture.

1BDA43167BCF4B74913E9F625E7125B8.description: Students will know that scripture is God’s Word.

E234D489C614425D971BB7801A1B4611.description: Students will know that on Mt. Sinai God gave his law to Moses and the people of Israel so that they might serve him as the one true God.

D57AD0B63B0745A5B5872BE844252591.description: Students will know the meaning of God’s covenant with Noah, with Abraham, and with Moses.

E1D47B1D4C34408297FCAC9989AF15EC.description: Students will know that God’s response to sin was to promise salvation and offer a covenant relationship.

9FDCC33AD2AB4977950A7CBD95CFA563.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Revelation.

F58DAEDA6DD64BBCAE6F5FFDED82F5A2.description: Students will know that Church leaders have the authority to explain scripture and tradition.

86BEF184E2A44EBB84BEDA537F435B76.description: Students will know that one Church includes a diversity of members.

CA4E7EE881994A189299FFB6EE529E3E.description: Students will know that the Church is the Kingdom of God present in mystery.

430FA2F519DF40778338F418DC66FA35.description: Students will know that everyone in the Church shares in Christ’s role as priest, prophet and king.

CB4F7264C4434FE1875B74F6C8995649.description: Students will know that the Church is Trinitarian: prepared by the Father, founded by the Son, revealed by the Holy Spirit.

7B4D038DFDA948809F1513D3401B3FA1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church.

ED7D5D03C7F345F1B5A9B30EE8B8AF0C.description: Students will know the seven gifts of the Holy Spirit.

2ABBF8A3960E4BA19F89A13674ECC17C.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit directs the Church leaders in teaching and guiding the faithful.

023F1FEA197A4E5C899EF02191897620.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit forgives our sins and restores the life of the Trinity in us.

19D021B416AB4DAD8D14AA131896240A.description: Students will know that at Pentecost the risen Lord pours out the Holy Spirit.

08B9757265784F4BB28AB079D580A3A4.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Holy Spirit.

0EF0911742484AB7AD4DA1C80AF50EFD.description: Students will know that the Paschal Mystery includes the death and resurrection of Jesus and that he died for our sins and rose for our justification.

0123FB2C795040A49C1AF0CD72CC98B4.description: Students will know that Jesus experienced death, but his body did not decay in the tomb.

781B691881EA44119E2F94B8817CC28A.description: Students will know that in everything he did, Jesus is our model.

B39579BEE29D417DBCC35D87D9E2F21D.description: Students will know that Mary conceived the Son by the power of the Holy Spirit.

1894E19361D444C28CFB61AC3DD6EE07.description: Students will know that Jesus wants us to be happy and to share the Good News to all the world.

840F7F8BF7B14FB0A6E8D9DAD325B90A.description: Students will know that Jesus gave himself up for each one of us.

F6033B7E762D4E1AB3D157C6F866F57A.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Son.

68B44C43896B4CECAF1C399E9BD24931.description: Students will know that Satan and other devils are fallen angels who freely refused to serve God.

DCDDB44628DD4F17A27B5B57A2254810.description: Students will know that men and woman are made in the image of God and are stewards of all creation.

BF89539A4B9641758500A62BCFC4853E.description: Students will know that God communicates a loving plan for all that he has created.

D83BB3E493384A89AA17F0BC83477C65.description: Students will know that our heavenly Father takes care of everything in his creation.

33DD948258F847B48163EB98A8E3EDF4.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Father.

C7036483A1E94C1C91CF7D24E760ABE2.description: Students will know that showing love to others is the way we show the love of the Trinity.

FB84C578C0694A139A26A9C9635A9ECA.description: Students will know that God is always faithful.

4A11C358FF8D4D799B88756AAB58CE1F.description: Students will know that God is truth and is all knowing.

217A72A61FDC4447AB8AE362D015F10E.description: Students will know that God communicates Himself gradually to us.

ACB31CC9352D48F496AB4B2EC5435B2D.description: Students will know that we are made in the image and likeness of God.

C6EBC1D5CEA94682BE9B73B84B2D433A.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Triune God.
